info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Davie County through 545 PM EDT... At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Mocksville, or 7 miles south of Bermuda Run, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mocksville, Bermuda Run, Fork Church, Advance and Farmington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
